speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: My dear brothers and sisters, it’s such a wonderful occasion to be with you in this marvelous general conference session today: to listen to inspired messages; to listen to this marvelous, amazing choir of missionaries representing the many thousands of missionaries all around the world—our daughters, our sons—and especially to be united in our faith today, again sustaining our dear President and prophet, President Russell M. Nelson, the First Presidency, and the General Officers of the Church. What a joyful day to be with you today.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: The ancient King Solomon was one of the most outwardly successful human beings in history. 1 He seemed to have everything—money, power, adoration, honor. But after decades of self-indulgence and luxury, how did King Solomon sum up his life?

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: “All is vanity,” 2 he said.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: This man, who had it all, ended up disillusioned, pessimistic, and unhappy, despite everything he had going for him. 3

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: There is a word in German, Weltschmerz. Loosely defined, it means a sadness that comes from brooding about how the world is inferior to how we think it ought to be.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: Perhaps there is a little Weltschmerz in all of us.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: When silent sorrows creep into the corners of our lives. When sadness saturates our days and casts deep shadows over our nights. When tragedy and injustice enter the world around us, including in the lives of those we love. When we journey through our own personal and lonely path of misfortune, and pain darkens our stillness and breaches our tranquility—we might be tempted to agree with Solomon that life is vain and devoid of meaning.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: The good news is, there is hope. There is a solution to the emptiness, vanity, and Weltschmerz of life. There is a solution to even the deepest hopelessness and discouragement you might feel.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: This hope is found in the transformative power of the gospel of Jesus Christ and in the Savior’s redemptive power to heal us of our soul-sickness.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: “I am come,” Jesus declared, “that they might have life, and that they might have it more abundantly.” 4

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: We achieve that abundant life not by focusing on our own needs or on our own achievements but by becoming true disciples of Jesus Christ—by following in His ways and engaging in His work. We find the abundant life by forgetting ourselves and engaging in the great cause of Christ.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: And what is the cause of Christ? It is to believe in Him, love as He loved, and do as He did.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: Jesus “went about doing good.” 5 He walked among the poor, the outcast, the sick, and the ashamed. He ministered to the powerless, the weak, and the friendless. He spent time with them; He spoke with them. “And he healed them all.” 6

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: Everywhere He went, the Savior taught the “good news” 7 of the gospel. He shared eternal truths that set people free spiritually as well as temporally.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: Those who dedicate themselves to Christ’s cause discover the truth of the Savior’s promise: “Whosoever will lose his life for my sake shall find it.” 8

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: Solomon was wrong, my dear brothers and sisters—life is not “vanity.” To the contrary, it can be full of purpose, meaning, and peace.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: The healing hands of Jesus Christ reach out to all who seek Him. I have come to know without a doubt that believing and loving God and striving to follow Christ can change our hearts, 9 soften our pain, and fill our souls with “exceedingly great joy.” 10

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: Of course, we must do more than merely have an intellectual understanding of the gospel for it to have this healing influence in our lives. We must incorporate it into our lives—make it a part of who we are and what we do.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: May I suggest that discipleship begins with three simple words:

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: Believe, love, and do.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: Believing God leads to faith in Him and developing trust in His word. Faith causes our hearts to grow in our love for God and others. As that love grows, we are inspired to emulate the Savior as we continue our own great journey on the path of discipleship.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: “But,” you say, “that seems a bit simplistic. Life’s problems, certainly my problems, are far too complex for such a simple prescription. You can’t cure Weltschmerz with three simple words: Believe, love, do. ”

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: It is not the aphorism that cures. It is the love of God that rescues, restores, and revives.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: God knows you. You are His child. He loves you.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: Even when you think that you are not lovable, He reaches out to you.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: This very day—every day—He reaches out to you, desiring to heal you, to lift you up, and to replace the emptiness in your heart with an abiding joy. He desires to sweep away any darkness that clouds your life and fill it with the sacred and brilliant light of His unending glory.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: I have experienced this for myself.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: And it is my witness as an Apostle of the Lord Jesus Christ that all who come unto God—all who truly believe, love, and do —can experience the same.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: The scriptures teach us that “without faith it is impossible to please [God]: for he that cometh to God must believe that he is.” 11

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: For some, the act of believing is difficult. Sometimes our pride gets in the way. Perhaps we think that because we are intelligent, educated, or experienced, we simply cannot believe in God. And we begin to look at religion as foolish tradition. 12

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: In my experience, belief is not so much like a painting we look at and admire and about which we discuss and theorize. It is more like a plow that we take into the fields and, by the sweat of our brow, create furrows in the earth that accept seeds and bear fruit that shall remain. 13

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: Draw near to God, and He will draw near to you. 14 This is the promise to all who seek to believe.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: The scriptures reveal that the more we love God and His children, the happier we become. 15 The love Jesus spoke about, however, isn’t a gift-card, throwaway, move-on-to-other-things love. It isn’t a love that is spoken of and then forgotten. It is not a “let me know if there is anything I can do” sort of love.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: The love God speaks of is the kind that enters our hearts when we awake in the morning, stays with us throughout the day, and swells in our hearts as we give voice to our prayers of gratitude at evening’s end.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: This is the inexpressible love Heavenly Father has for us.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: It is this endless compassion that allows us to more clearly see others for who they are. Through the lens of pure love, we see immortal beings of infinite potential and worth and beloved sons and daughters of Almighty God.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: Once we see through that lens, we cannot discount, disregard, or discriminate against anyone.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: In the Savior’s work, it is often by small and simple means that “great things [are] brought to pass.” 16

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: We know that it requires repetitive practice to become good at anything. Whether it’s playing the clarinet, kicking a ball into a net, repairing a car, or even flying an airplane, it is through practicing that we may become better and better. 17

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: The organization our Savior created on earth—The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints—helps us to do just that. It offers a place to practice living the way He taught and blessing others the way He did.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: As Church members, we are given callings, responsibilities, and opportunities to reach out in compassion and minister to others.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: Recently, the Church has placed a renewed emphasis on ministering, or serving or loving others. Great thought was taken to determine what we should call this special emphasis.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: One of the names considered was shepherding, a fitting reference to Christ’s invitation: “Feed my sheep.” 18 However, it had at least one complication: using that term would make me a German shepherd. Consequently, I am quite content with the term ministering.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: Of course, this emphasis is not new. It simply provides a renewed and refined opportunity for us to practice the Savior’s commandment to “love one another,” 19 a refined way to implement and practice the purpose of the Church.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: Just think about missionary work; the courageous, humble, and confident sharing of the gospel is a wonderful example of ministering to the spiritual needs of others, whoever they are.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: Or doing temple work—seeking out the names of our ancestors and offering them the blessings of eternity. What a divine way of ministering.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: Consider the act of seeking out the poor and the needy, lifting the hands that hang down, or blessing the sick and afflicted. Aren’t these the very acts of pure ministering the Lord practiced when He walked the earth?

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: If you are not a member of the Church, I invite you to “come and see.” 20 Come and join with us. If you are a member of the Church but presently not participating actively, I invite you: please come back. We need you!

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: Come, add your strengths to ours.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: Because of your unique talents, abilities, and personality, you will help us become better and happier. In return, we will help you become better and happier as well.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: Come, help us build and strengthen a culture of healing, kindness, and mercy toward all of God’s children. For we are all striving to become new creatures where “old things are passed away” and “all things … become new.” 21 The Savior shows us the direction to move—forward and upward. He says, “If ye love me, keep my commandments.” 22 Let us all work together to become the people God intended for us to become.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: This is the kind of gospel culture we desire to cultivate throughout the Church of Jesus Christ. We seek to strengthen the Church as a place where we forgive one another. Where we resist the temptation to find fault, gossip, and bring others down. Where, instead of pointing out flaws, we lift up and help each other to become the best we can be.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: Let me invite you again. Come and see. Join with us. We need you.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: You will find that this Church is filled with some of the finest people this world has to offer. They are welcoming, loving, kind, and sincere. They are hardworking, willing to sacrifice, and even heroic at times.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: And they are also painfully imperfect.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: They make mistakes.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: From time to time they say things they shouldn’t. They do things they wish they hadn’t.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: But they do have this in common—they want to improve and draw closer to the Lord, our Savior, even Jesus Christ.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: They are trying to get it right.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: They believe. They love. They do.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: They want to become less selfish, more compassionate, more refined, more like Jesus.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: Yes, life can be hard at times. Certainly we all have our times of despair and discouragement.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: But the gospel of Jesus Christ offers hope. And, in the Church of Jesus Christ, we join with others who seek a place where we can feel at home—a place of growth where, together, we can believe, love, and do.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: Regardless of our differences, we seek to embrace one another as sons and daughters of our beloved Heavenly Father.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: I am grateful beyond measure to be a member of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints and to know that God loves His children enough to give them a blueprint for happiness and meaning in this life and a way to experience eternal joy in the halls of glory in the life to come.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: I am grateful that God has given us a way to heal the soul-sicknesses and the Weltschmerz of life.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Believe, Love, Do
paragraph_text: I testify and leave you my blessing that as we believe in God, as we love Him and love His children with all our hearts, and as we strive to do as God has instructed us, we will find healing and peace, happiness and meaning. In the sacred name of Jesus Christ, amen.
